abstract: Several developments show that noise activists in Queens are beginning to receive serious attention from Port Authority of New York and New Jersey officials after years of intense lobbying; dialog has improved between activists, airport administrators and residents who have long suffered due to noise from LaGuardia and JFK International Airport.
lead_paragraph: After years of intense and frustrating lobbying, noise pollution activists say that airport leaders are finally starting to listen to them.

headline.main: Engaging in a Softer Conversation About the Roar From New York’s Airports
headline.print_headline: Engaging in a Softer Conversation About the Roar From Above

snippet: After years of intense and frustrating lobbying, noise pollution activists say that airport leaders are finally starting to listen to them.

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
